event.headline_as_text: Smuin's "The Christmas Ballet", a Bay Area Holiday Tradition
event.headline_as_html: Smuin's The Christmas Ballet, a Bay Area Holiday Tradition

venue.name: Yerba Buena Center for the Arts Lam Research Theater

event.summary_as_text: Annual favorite "The Christmas Ballet" makes its return to the Bay Area for the holiday season. The wildly popular snow-filled extravaganza from Smuin Ballet boasts everything from Bach and sacred carols to klezmer, gospel and Elvis, plus dances from around the world set to seasonal music. This year's edition includes new choreography from acclaimed Choreographer in Residence Amy Seiwert, Smuin dancer Jane Rehm and former Smuin dancer Darren Anderson to accompany time-honored favorites in an always-changing feast of holiday fun.

event.headline_as_text: San Francisco Ballet's "Nutcracker", Set in the City by the Bay
event.headline_as_html: San Francisco Ballet's Nutcracker, Set in the City by the Bay
event.summary_as_text: On Christmas Eve 1944, "Nutcracker" made its American debut in San Francisco. So it's only fitting that when San Francisco Ballet Artistic Director and Principal Choreographer Helgi Tomasson set out to stage a new production of the beloved family favorite more than 60 years later, he chose the City by the Bay as the backdrop. Set in San Francisco during the 1915 World's Fair, Clara's dreamlike journey is an ode to the city's historical grandeur -- set amidst colorful, larger-than-life scenery, more than 200 dazzling costumed characters, and of course Tchaikovsky's beautiful score performed live by the world-class San Francisco Ballet Orchestra. Please see the full event description for information on special Family Performances.

event.headline_as_text: Bewitching Romantic Comedy "Bell, Book & Candle" at SF Playhouse
event.headline_as_html: Bewitching Romantic Comedy Bell, Book & Candle at SF Playhouse
event.summary_as_text: SF Playhouse presents "Bell, Book & Candle", the famed '50s-era Christmas-time comedy that was in part the inspiration for the television series "Bewitched". Set during the holiday season, John Van Druten's play is a playful and romantic winter romp that finds Gillian, a free-spirited white witch, living in Greenwich Village. She's been unlucky in love and unsettled in life when she discovers her neighbor Shep is going to marry an old rival of hers. Gillian casts a love spell on him to thwart her enemy, but when she starts to fall for him herself, she faces a tough choice: witches who choose love are doomed to lose their magical powers permanently.

event.headline_as_text: "Tough Jobby, Boot: Tis Yule": Critically-Acclaimed Comedic One-Man Show
event.headline_as_html: Tough Jobby, Boot: Tis Yule: Critically-Acclaimed Comedic One-Man Show
event.summary_as_text: Hot off a popular and critically acclaimed UK run, talented writer-performer Will Franken brings his comedic one-man show "Tough Jobby, Boot: Tis Yule" to the Eureka Theatre. Franken was among the best reviewed performers of this year's Edinburgh Festival, receiving four-star reviews from "The Guardian", the "Times of London" and the "Independent", among many others. "Tough Jobby" features an entirely new assortment of characters and vignettes from the hilarious performer, including Glaswegian Jack Rabbit, a self-described professional eavesdropper, shy British teens who ask girls out to the Museum of Modern Fruit and a man who murders people in line at a burrito stand out of impatience.
event.title_as_html: Will Franken in Tough Jobby, Boot: Tis Yule
